Literature Review: Pooled genome-scale CRISPR screens in single cells have revolutionized the field of functional genomics, enabling researchers to efficiently and unbiasedly assign functions to genes and control their expression. This approach has been made possible by the rapid technological progress in modulating gene function with CRISPR-Cas and measuring it in individual cells. Here, we review the principles and practical considerations for pooled single-cell CRISPR screening, focusing on single-cell RNA sequencing and cell sorting-based readouts.
